title: Biloxi, Mississippi
summary: Biloxi (/bɪˈlʌksi/ bih-LUK-see; French: [bilusi]) is a city in and one of two county seats of Harrison County, Mississippi, United States (the other seat being the adjoining city of Gulfport). The 2010 United States Census recorded the population as 44,054[3] and in 2019 the estimated population was 46,212.[4] The area's first European settlers were French colonists.
